availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Yancy Lyttle (Clay County, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, attorney. Lee County, Virginia, native. Married to Drusilla Posey Brittain Lyttle. Father of George B. Lyttle, Dale C. Lyttle, Carlo B. Lyttle, Nancy E. Lyttle, John James Lyttle, Sally Lyttle, and Lee Lyttle. Attorney in Harlan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Harlan County in 1850. Attorney in Clay County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860. Served in the Kentucky Home Guard (U.S.A.) as colonel.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 1, p. 25A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 89.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 350A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, District 32, Precinct 1, p. 154B.
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Special Schedules of Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Veterans of the Civil War, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester.
Charles Kerr, William Elsley Connelley, and E.M. Coulter, History of Kentucky, Volume 5 (Chicago: American Historical Society Press, 1922), p. 451.
